page.title: 12Ecology, Gipsey Bridge
page.content: Most of the area is farmland We find rabbits,hedgehogs, foxes,fieldmice,plover, pheasants,pigeon, sparrows,moles, ducks and rats. Most of the dykes and drains make a home for Daphnia, midges, larvae,fishes,pikes and eels. Some of the area is grassland where grasshoppers,crickets and snakes live. The farmers are digging up the hedges which means that we do not see many birds such as the greenfinch ,goldfinch,chafffinch, bullfinch and linnet. Some are very rare because of the chemicals which are put on the land .The birds are affected because the chemicals get into the drains and dykes where they drink and onto the crops which they eat. The shells of the birds eggs are weak because of these chemicals, they break easily.
